title: Meghan Markle Looks Chic in a White Shirtdress for the Final Day of the Royal Tour
text:
Photo credit: Chris Jackson - Getty Images More

From Harper's BAZAAR

Meghan Markle and Prince Harry stepped out in unison for the final day of the royal tour on Wednesday.

The Duchess of Sussex wore a crisp white shirt dress for the occasion.

The couple visited the Youth Employment Services organization in Johannesburg.

Duchess Meghan and Prince Harry have had an extremely busy schedule throughout their 10-day royal tour of South Africa.

Having undertaken several solo engagements over the past few days, the royals reunited for their visit to Youth Employment Services, also known as the Yes organization, in Johannesburg, which is dedicated to creating new work opportunities in the area.

Arriving hand-in-hand, Meghan wore a chic white shirt dress, while Harry kept things smart in a suit.

Photo credit: Samir Hussein - Getty Images More

Photo credit: Karwai Tang - Getty Images More

Reporting on the couple's arrival, BAZAAR.com's royal editor at large Omid Scobie tweeted, "Prince Harry and Duchess Meghan arrive at @Yes4YouthZA in the Tembisa township and are greeted by YES CEO Tashmia Ismail-Saville." He continued, "The couple will now tour @Yes4YouthZA, which is a business-led collaboration with government and labour to create one million work opportunities for youth in South Africa."

The couple will now tour @Yes4YouthZA, which is a business-led collaboration with government and labour to create one million work opportunities for youth in South Africa. pic.twitter.com/PRgDLfChOK — Omid Scobie (@scobie) October 2, 2019

According to The Sun's royal correspondent Emily Andrews, the duke and duchess were excited to visit Blossom, a business owned by local women in the community making sanitary towels, which are fully compostable.
description: The duke and duchess arrived in Johannesburg holding hands.
